episodeTitle: Deadly Combat under the Sea! The Demon of the Ocean Strikes!
episodeTitleJapanese: 海中の死闘　現れた大海原の悪魔
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaichū no Shitō - Arawareta Ōunabara no Akuma
description: The Caribou Pirates attack the Straw Hats underwater. While Caribou boards the Thousand Sunny, Momoo recognizes the crew and flees with Caribou's crew. The Straw Hats then encounter the Kraken, which destroys the Caribou Pirates' ship and attacks them. The crew showcases their new post-timeskip abilities as Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji prepare to fight the massive sea monster.

events.title: Caribou Pirates Attack the Thousand Sunny
events.description: The Caribou Pirates attack the Straw Hat crew underwater as their bubble-coated ships come close together. Caribou orders his crew to rush onto the Thousand Sunny to capture the crew.
events.significance: Sets up the confrontation between the Caribou Pirates and the post-timeskip Straw Hats, demonstrating the crew's increased power levels.

events.title: Momoo Appears and Recognizes the Straw Hats
events.description: Momoo, the sea cow, appears and pulls away most of the Caribou Pirates' crew. He immediately recognizes Nami, Sanji, and Luffy from their encounter at Arlong Park and flees in fear, leaving Caribou alone on the Thousand Sunny.
events.significance: Callbacks to the Arlong Park arc and demonstrates the lasting impact of the Straw Hats' earlier adventures. This also isolates Caribou from his crew.

events.title: Caribou Captured by the Straw Hats
events.description: Realizing he is alone and outnumbered, Caribou begs the Straw Hats not to throw him into the sea and makes excuses to spare his life. The crew captures him.
events.significance: Caribou becomes a temporary prisoner on the Thousand Sunny, setting up his continued presence through the Fish-Man Island arc.

quotes.text: Please don't throw me into the sea!
quotes.speaker: Caribou
quotes.context: Caribou begging for mercy after being left alone on the Thousand Sunny

events.title: Nami Explains Undersea Currents
events.description: Nami provides the crew with an explanation about the dangerous undersea currents they must navigate on their journey to Fish-Man Island. The ship is suddenly caught in a downward current.
events.significance: Establishes the dangers of underwater navigation and showcases Nami's continued role as the crew's navigator with expert knowledge.

events.title: Surume the Kraken's Debut
events.description: The Straw Hats encounter Surume, a massive Kraken blocking their path underwater. The colossal sea monster appears as a formidable obstacle, described as a demon of the ocean.
events.significance: Introduces Surume, who becomes an important ally later in the Fish-Man Island arc. This is the first appearance of a Kraken in the One Piece anime.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: The crew's reaction to seeing the massive sea monster

events.title: Luffy Decides to Tame the Kraken
events.description: Upon seeing the massive Kraken, Luffy immediately gets excited and declares his intention to tame it rather than simply defeat it.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's characteristic optimism and his unique approach to problems. Sets up the eventual taming of Surume.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excited response to seeing the Kraken

events.title: Kraken Destroys the Caribou Pirates' Ship
events.description: The Caribou Pirates return to rescue their captain, but their ship is immediately destroyed by one of the Kraken's tentacles, demonstrating the creature's immense power.
events.significance: Shows the overwhelming strength of the Kraken and eliminates the Caribou Pirates as a threat, leaving only their captain.

events.title: Franky Demonstrates New Rocket Launchers
events.description: Franky reveals his post-timeskip upgrades by using new rocket launchers to defend the Thousand Sunny from the Kraken's attacks.
events.significance: First demonstration of Franky's enhanced weaponry after his two-year upgrade period with Vegapunk's technology.

events.title: Chopper Uses Guard Point Underwater
events.description: Chopper transforms into his Guard Point form to protect the Thousand Sunny from the Kraken's attacks, demonstrating his improved control over his Devil Fruit abilities.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's improved mastery of his Zoan transformations after the timeskip training.

events.title: Robin's Mil Fleur: Gigantesco Mano Debut
events.description: Nico Robin demonstrates her new post-timeskip technique 'Mil Fleur: Gigantesco Mano' (Thousand Flower: Gigantic Hand), creating a massive hand that protects the ship from a boulder thrown by the Kraken.
events.significance: Robin's first major display of her enhanced Hana Hana no Mi abilities after training. This technique becomes one of her signature moves post-timeskip.

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin activating her new technique to protect the ship

events.title: The Monster Trio Prepares to Fight
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji coat themselves in protective bubbles and prepare to leave the ship to battle the Kraken directly in the underwater environment.
events.significance: Sets up the first major underwater battle showcasing the Monster Trio's post-timeskip abilities.

events.title: Luffy Prepares Gear Third
events.description: The episode ends with Luffy preparing to activate his Gear Third technique to fight the Kraken, creating a cliffhanger ending.
events.significance: Teases the upcoming demonstration of Luffy's improved Gear Third, which no longer has the shrinking side effect after training.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excited response to seeing the Kraken

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin activating her new technique to protect the ship

quotes.text: Please don't throw me into the sea!
quotes.speaker: Caribou
quotes.context: Caribou begging for mercy after being left alone

themes.description: The episode showcases how each Straw Hat member has grown stronger during the two-year timeskip, with multiple crew members demonstrating new techniques and abilities.
themes.symbolism: The Kraken represents the new level of challenges the crew will face in the New World, requiring their enhanced abilities.

themes.description: Momoo's appearance and recognition of the Straw Hats connects to their earlier adventure in the Arlong Park arc, showing how their reputation precedes them.
themes.symbolism: Momoo's fear represents how far the crew has come since their East Blue days.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her significantly enhanced Devil Fruit abilities with the debut of Mil Fleur: Gigantesco Mano.
keyActions: Creates a giant hand to protect the ship from a boulder

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his characteristic optimism by wanting to tame rather than defeat the Kraken, and prepares to use his improved Gear Third.
keyActions: Prepares to fight with Zoro and Sanji
Gets ready to activate Gear Third

characterSpotlights.development: Caribou goes from threatening attacker to captured prisoner, showing his cowardice when faced with genuine power.
keyActions: Begs for mercy from the Straw Hats
quotes: Please don't throw me into the sea!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some action sequences and reactions to the Kraken's appearance for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode adapted more manga content than typical episodes at the time, covering parts of both chapters 604 and 605.
Surume the Kraken is 300 meters (984 feet) tall and has at least 18 tentacles, more than a regular octopus.
This is the first appearance of a Logia-type Devil Fruit user (Caribou with the Numa Numa no Mi) after the two-year timeskip.

sources.title: Numa Numa no Mi - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode aired on November 20, 2011 in Japan, but was simulcast on November 19, 2011 in the US due to time zone differences.
